Stash Marker Genes in a SingleCellExperiment Object

Source: R/cluster.R
stash_marker_features.Rd

Marker Genes will be stored in object metadata as markers

Usage

stash_marker_features(
  object,
  group_by,
  experiment = "gene",
  top_n = 200,
  p_val_cutoff = 0.5
)

Arguments

object

A object

group_by

A metadata variable to group by

experiment

An experiment to use

top_n

Use top n genes, Default 200

p_val_cutoff

p value cut-off, Default value is "0.5"

Value

a SingleCellExperiment object with marker genes

Examples

data("small_example_dataset")
small_example_dataset <- 
find_all_markers(small_example_dataset, "gene_snn_res.1")
#> stashing markers for gene_snn_res.1
stash_marker_features(small_example_dataset, "gene_snn_res.1")
#> stashing markers for gene_snn_res.1
#> # A tibble: 285 × 4
#> # Groups:   Cluster [5]
#>    Gene.Name Average.Log.Fold.Change Adjusted.pvalue Cluster
#>    <chr>                       <dbl>           <dbl> <chr>  
#>  1 Gene_0977                    1.99           0.313 1      
#>  2 Gene_0373                    1.99           0.270 1      
#>  3 Gene_0827                    1.98           0.270 1      
#>  4 Gene_0948                    1.85           0.270 1      
#>  5 Gene_0633                    1.82           0.318 1      
#>  6 Gene_0262                    1.82           0.270 1      
#>  7 Gene_0784                    1.69           0.270 1      
#>  8 Gene_0750                    1.67           0.342 1      
#>  9 Gene_0329                    1.62           0.361 1
